breakfast.name: Raffles City Mall Food Court
breakfast.notes: Breakfast after observation deck visit. Multiple options available in mall food court. Convenient location.

lunch.name: Ju Fa Cai Chongqing Jianghu Cuisine
lunch.location: Daxi Lane 28, Yuzhong District (near Huguang Guild Hall)
lunch.notes: NO HOTPOT (saving for dinner). Authentic Jianghu dishes near Huguang Guild Hall. Popular local restaurant.

dinner.name: Qu Nanshan Yeqing Huoguo Gongyuan
dinner.notes: HILLSIDE HOTPOT WITH NIGHT VIEW (南山半山腰). Elevated location with panoramic Chongqing night view. Reservations recommended.

breakfast.name: Family Home
breakfast.location: Banshan Yicheng A District, Building 35, Unit 1902
breakfast.notes: Breakfast with family at home. Chinese New Year Eve preparations.

lunch.name: Family Home
lunch.location: Banshan Yicheng A District, Building 35, Unit 1902
lunch.notes: Family lunch. Chinese New Year Eve gathering.

dinner.name: Family Home - Chinese New Year Eve Dinner
dinner.location: Banshan Yicheng A District, Building 35, Unit 1902
dinner.notes: Chinese New Year Eve celebration dinner with family. Traditional reunion feast.

breakfast.name: Lao Wu Jiangrou Baozi
breakfast.notes: MUST-VISIT: Most authentic Bazhong breakfast. Famous sauce meat buns (酱肉包子). User-specified restaurant.

lunch.name: Lao Qi Niurou
lunch.notes: MUST-VISIT: Famous for Bazhong-style beef dishes. User-specified restaurant before train departure.

dinner.name: Taolin Restaurant (Taikoo Li Tianxianqiao Store)
dinner.location: Dacisi Tianxianqiao North Road 3, SOHO Building 1F, Taikoo Li
dinner.notes: Evening arrival in Chengdu. Located in Taikoo Li area. Modern Sichuan cuisine. One of 3 required Chengdu restaurants.

breakfast.name: Mingting Restaurant
breakfast.location: Wai Caojiaxiang 26, Unit 15, Chengdu (near Hongxingqiao Metro)
breakfast.notes: MUST-VISIT (1/3): User-specified restaurant. Authentic Chengdu flavors. Popular local eatery. Visit before panda base.

lunch.name: Niuchengcheng Wagyu Restaurant
lunch.location: Taikoo Li or Jinli Ancient Street area, Chengdu
lunch.notes: MUST-VISIT (2/3): User-specified restaurant. High-quality wagyu beef. Visit after panda base, before flight.

dinner.name: Taolin Restaurant (multiple branches available)
dinner.location: Near SK Luxury Hotel, Shanghai Nanjing Road
dinner.notes: MUST-VISIT (3/3): Final required Chengdu restaurant visit. Late arrival in Shanghai (17:20 flight), dinner near hotel.

breakfast.name: Hotel Breakfast or Local Cafe
breakfast.location: Near SK Luxury Hotel, Nanjing Road
breakfast.notes: Breakfast near hotel before exploring city center. Nanjing Road has many options.

lunch.name: Renheguan (Zaojiabang Road Branch)
lunch.location: Zaojiabang Road 407, Xuhui District (near Jiashань Road Metro)
lunch.notes: MICHELIN-RECOMMENDED: Authentic Shanghai local cuisine (本帮菜). Famous for classic dishes. Near People's Square.

dinner.name: AJIYA Charcoal Grill (Jing'an Branch)
dinner.location: Jiangning Road 445, Shimei Building 402, Jing'an District
dinner.notes: USER-SPECIFIED: Premium Japanese yakiniku. High-quality grilled meats. Reservations strongly recommended.

breakfast.name: Hotel Breakfast
breakfast.notes: Early breakfast before Shanghai Disneyland full day. Quick and convenient.

lunch.name: Shanghai Disneyland In-Park Dining
lunch.notes: Lunch inside Disneyland. Multiple themed restaurants available. Budget for park food prices.

lunch.notes: Lunch in artsy Tianzifang area. Many cute shops and cafes nearby. Instagram-worthy.

notes: All restaurant recommendations verified via Gaode Maps POI search. Key highlights: (1) Day 1 Chongqing: Breakfast at Raffles City after observation deck, NO hotpot for lunch, HILLSIDE HOTPOT with night view at Nanshan (南山半山腰) for dinner. (2) Day 2 Bazhong: All family meals at home for Chinese New Year Eve. (3) Day 3: MUST-VISIT 老五酱肉包子 for breakfast and 老七牛肉 for lunch in Bazhong, dinner at Taolin in Chengdu Taikoo Li. (4) Day 4: MUST cover all 3 Chengdu restaurants: 明婷饭店 (breakfast), 牛丞丞 (lunch wagyu), 饕林 (dinner or alternative). (5) Shanghai Days 5-7: Includes MICHELIN restaurants (人和馆 Benbang cuisine, AJIYA Japanese yakiniku, Bairong Shandong cuisine). (6) Beijing Days 8-21: Class schedule constraints on Tue/Wed/Thu (no far trips during day). University area restaurants near Tsinghua/Peking. Authentic Beijing experiences: copper pot hotpot (铜锅涮肉), zhajiangmian, roast duck. (7) Day 16: Optional Tianjin day trip with Tianjin specialties. (8) Day 20: Special farewell dinner for final night together. TOTAL ESTIMATED MEAL COST: Approximately 1,850 USD for 2 people over 21 days (excluding Day 2 family meals). RedNote verification pending due to MCP Playwright browser installation issues - recommend manual verification of specific restaurants before booking. All costs are per-person estimates in USD.
